ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS VEHICLES OBTAINED FOR MINISTER OF PLAN IMPLEMENTATION 0896/07 01. . . .
( ( . . . ) (The Hon. R. P. A. Ranaweera Pathirana) - (1) : () (i) ; (ii) ; (iii) ; ? () ? () (i) ; (ii) ; ? () (i) ; (ii) ; ? () , ?

() (i) , (ii) ? () (i) , (ii) ? () , ? asked the Minister of Plan Implementation: (a) Will he inform this House, - (i) the number of vehicles obtained for the Minister of Plan Implementation and his personal staff; (ii) the basis on which these vehicles have been obtained: (iii) out of them, the number of vehicles obtained on hire or contract basis?

(b) Will he state in this House from which institutions or individuals the said vehicles have been obtained, along with their names and addresses ? (c) Will he state separately in respect of each vehicle, - (i) the types of such vehicles ; (ii) The amount of money spent on those vehicles and the amount of the money allocated for fuel, monthly and annually ? (d) Will he state, - (i) if drivers had been recruited for these vehicles, the basis on which they were recruited ; (ii) their salaries and allowances ? (f) If not, why ?
VEHICLES OBTAINED FOR MINISTER OF SUPPLEMENTARY PLANTATION CROPS DEVELOPMENT 0897/07 02. . . .

() (i) , (ii) ? () , ? asked the Minister of Supplementary Plantation Crops Development: (a) Will he inform this House, (i) the number of vehicles obtained for the Minister of Supplementary Plantation Crops Development and Deputy Minister of Supplementary Plantation Crops Development and their personal staff; (ii) the basis on which these vehicles have been obtained: (iii) out of them, the number of vehicles obtained on hire or contract basis? (b) Will he state in this House from which institutions or individuals the said vehicles have been obtained, along with their names and addresses ? (c) Will he state separately in respect of each vehicle, - (i) the types of such vehicles ; (ii) The amount of money spent on those vehicles and the amount of the money allocated for fuel, monthly and annually ? (d) Will he state, - (i) if drivers had been recruited for these vehicles, the basis on which they were recruited ; (ii) their salaries and allowances ? (f) If not, why ?

asked the Minister of Parliamentary Affairs-: (a) Will he inform this House, (i) the number of vehicles obtained for the Minis-ter of Parliamentary Affairs and his personal staff; (ii) the basis on which these vehicles have been obtained; (iii) out of them, the number of vehicles obtained on hire or contact basis? (b) Will he state in this House from which institutions or individuals the said vehicles have been ob-tained, along with their names and addresses? (c) Will he state separately in respect of each vehi-cle, (i) the types of such vehicles; (ii) the amount of money spent on those vehicles and the amount of the money allocated for fuel, monthly and annually? (d) Will he state, (i) if drivers had been recruited for these vehicles, the basis on which they were recruited; (ii) their salaries and allowances? (d) If not, why?

( . . - ) (The Hon. (Prof.) W. A. Wiswa Warnapala - Minister of Higher Education) -
. ( . ) (The Hon. M. Joseph Michael Perera) , . ( ) (An hon. Member) .
. ( . ) (The Hon. M. Joseph Michael Perera) , [ ] ; . , [ ] . . What I am asking is, how many vehicles have not been returned ?
According to the answer given by my secretary, Two ve-hicles have not been returned. But I remember having spo-ken to the Minister concerned and he said only one vehicle is with him.
Your secretary says two and you say only one vehicle is due.
. . ( . . ) (The Hon. M. H. Mohamed) It is not a big issue for you to discuss. What is the issue in this ?
. ( . ) (The Hon. M. Joseph Michael Perera) There is an issue.
You are merely making a joke.

. ( . ) (The Hon. M. Joseph Michael Perera) There is an issue. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) There is an issue because irrespective of the peace pack-age submitted by the Hon. Wiswa Warnapala to President Mahinda Rajapaksa, he also migh taken into custody like the Hon. Sripathi Sooriyaarachchi. So, we are worried about you, Hon. Wiswa Warnapala.
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) . - ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) . [ ]

. . ( . . ) (The Hon. M. H. Mohamed) The Minister said he had some other work and he was held up. Only one vehicle is due. My secretary has given me the answer to this Question. But I agree that only one is due. I remember talking to him. He is very keen in teturning it. Think in a few days he may return it.

. . ( . . ) (The Hon. M. H. Mohamed) Mr. Speaker. I think the Members are taking either- ( ) (Mr. Speaker) . - [ ] ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) We have no problem, Hon. M.H. Mohoamed. That is not problem at all. That is not an issue. But we are also speaking on behalf of the rights of Members such as the Hon. Sripathi Sooriayaarachchi.
. . ( . . ) (The Hon. M. H. Mohamed) I have alredy explained it to you[ Intruption.]

. . ( . . ) (The Hon. M. H. Mohamed) The only thing I want point out is-

() ? asked the prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administra-tion and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order, : (a) Will he inform this House, - (i) the number of registered commercial banking Pawning dealers and non banking pawning dealars separately; (ii) their total business values separately for the last 10 years on per year basis; (iii) the total tax earned by the government from pawning activities; and What these taxes are? (b) Will he state that, (i) after how long, can these non banking pawning dealers confiscate the goods if the borrowers default? (ii) what is the percentage of this compared to the pawning industry? (c) If not, why ?

, ESTATES BELONGING TO STATE, PRIVATE SECTOR AND SMALL HOLDINGS

Asked the minister of Plantation Industries, - : (a) Will he state separately, - (i) the amount of estates belonging to the State, Pri-vate Sector and Small Holdings ; (ii) total number of tea, rubber and coconut in acreage; (iii) the total wages for employees of tea, rubber and coconut estates per year and per sector; and (iv) the average salary per day for each sector effected in 2002 to 2006 ? (b) Will he state,- (i) the number of employees working in these estates, the ethnic percentage of Sinhalese, Tamils, Indian Tamils and Muslims; (ii) whether they get any other benefits such as houses, lines, education etc.; and, (iii) the other fringe benefits that they get ? (c ) Will he state in this House the total cost of production compared against the average selling price in 1980, 1985, 1990, 1995, 2000, 2001, 2002 and 2003 ? (d) If not, why ?

EXPORTING TIMBER BELONGING TO TIMBER CORPORATION 1086/07 10.

(ii) ? ? () (i) , ; (ii) ; ? () , ? , : () (i) , (ii) , , (iii) , ? () (i) , (ii) ? () (i) , , (ii) , ? () , ? asked the Minister, Minister of Environment and Natural Resources, : (a) Will he state, -
(i) whether teak logs and other kinds of timber be-longing to the Timber Corporation are exported to overseas countries : (ii) if so, what those countries are ; and,
(iii) since which year ? (b) Will he state separately, -
(i) the price of such timber in the local market and the overseas market ; and,
(ii) the quantities of timber that have been exported uptonow? (c) Will he state,- (i) whether such timber will be sold to local entre-preneurs if they are willing to buy them at export rates ; and,
(ii) the reasons for exporting timber at a time when Sri Lanka is facing a severe shortage of timber ? (d) If not, why?

(b) Will he state,
(i) whether he will take steps to submit that Bill to Parliament; (ii) if so, when; and, (iii) if not, the reasons for that?,

( - . . - ) (The Hon. Nihal Galappaththi on behalf of The Hon. H. M. Wasantha Samarasinghe) - (1) : () / 1998 (hot line) ? () (i) ; (ii) ; (iii) ; (iv) , ; ? () , ?

() (i) , (ii) , (iii) , (iv) , ? () , ? asked the Minister of Power and Energy : (a) Will he inform this House in detail, the services rendered to electricity consumers through the Hot Line project launched in 1998 by the Lanka Elec-tricity Company Limited, a government owned Company ? (b) Will he state, (i) the total amount of money spent on this pro-ject ; (ii) the reason, if the project was not implemented from the inception until now ; (iii) whether the equipment and tools utilized for the relevant project can be used by now ; (iv) if not, the loss incurred by the company as a result ? (c) If not, why ?
( ) (The Hon. Jeyaraj Fernandopulle) , * . * : : Answer tabled () 1982 17 / () 1998 . , , Trailer 1998 . () (i) Trailer 10,585,523.21 . (ii) , , . (iii) . ( ) . (iv) . () .

() , ? Asked the minister of Trade, Marketing Development, Co-operatives and Consumer Services, - : (a) Is he aware that (i) Weat flour has been named as an essential con-sumer item;
(ii) the permission of the Consumer Service Authority has to be obtained in increasing the price of such a Commodity?

(b) Will he admit that legal action can be constituted against the relevant company for increasing the price of an essential commodity without obtaining permission ? (c ) Will he state (i) whether action would be taken to reduce the price of that commodity if that was the case; (ii) the measures that would be taken in respect of com-panies which increase prices irregularly ?
